DELETE /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/ce.description: Deletes a gateway-managed Zero Trust certificate. A certificate must be deactivated from the edge (inactive) before it is deleted.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

binding_status.description: The deployment status of the certificate on Cloudflare's edge. Certificates in the 'available' (previously called 'active') state may be used for Gateway TLS interception.

fingerprint.description: The SHA256 fingerprint of the certificate.

in_use.description: Use this certificate for Gateway TLS interception

issuer_org.description: The organization that issued the certificate.

issuer_raw.description: The entire issuer field of the certificate.

type.description: The type of certificate, either BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.

success.description: Whether the API call was successful

type.description: The type of certificate, either BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.

POST /accounts/{account_id}/gateway/cert.description: Creates a new Zero Trust certificate.

validity_period_days.description: Number of days the generated certificate will be valid, minimum 1 day and maximum 30 years. Defaults to 5 years. In terraform, validity_period_days can only be used while creating a certificate, and this CAN NOT be used to extend the validity of an already generated certificate.

type.description: The type of certificate, either BYO-PKI (custom) or Gateway-managed.
